intro: Chrysopsis fulcrata, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of bright yellow, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Chrysopsis fulcrata is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
